SEARCH
Package com.example.a1_jubair_6_frontend.managers

Class EngagementNotificationManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.a1_jubair_6_frontend.managers.EngagementNotificationManager
public class EngagementNotificationManager extends Object
Manages user engagement notifications for the application. This class handles the scheduling, creation, and sending of notifications to encourage user engagement based on their last access time. It supports different message types for various periods of inactivity (daily, weekly, and monthly).

  • Constructor Details

    • EngagementNotificationManager

      public EngagementNotificationManager(android.content.Context context)
      Constructs a new EngagementNotificationManager. Initializes the notification channel and schedules periodic engagement checks.
      Parameters:
      context - The application context used for accessing system services

  • Method Details

    • updateLastAccessTime

      public void updateLastAccessTime()
      Updates the timestamp of the user's last access to the application. This timestamp is used to calculate periods of inactivity.

    • scheduleEngagementCheck

      public void scheduleEngagementCheck()
      Schedules periodic checks for user engagement using WorkManager. Sets up a periodic work request that runs every 24 hours to check user activity and send notifications if needed.

    • checkAndSendEngagementNotification

      public void checkAndSendEngagementNotification()
      Checks the user's last access time and sends an appropriate notification if the user has been inactive for a significant period. Different messages are selected based on the duration of inactivity:
      • 30+ days: Monthly messages
      • 7+ days: Weekly messages
      • 1+ days: Daily messages
